name: coc-esbonio
description: esbonio ([Sphinx] Python Documentation Generator) language server extension for coc.nvim
author: yaegassy <yosstools@gmail.com>

esbonio.enableFixDirectiveCompletion.description: Enable fix patch for `Directive` completion issue

esbonio.client.sectionCharacterLevel1.description: Character to be used in the Section builder (level1) of the code action

esbonio.client.sectionCharacterLevel2.description: Character to be used in the Section builder (level2) of the code action

esbonio.client.sectionCharacterLevel3.description: Character to be used in the Section builder (level3) of the code action

esbonio.server.enabledInPyFiles.description: Enable/Disable the language server in Python files.

esbonio.server.startupModule.description: The module (or script) to use to launch the server.

esbonio.server.excludedModules.description: A list of modules to exclude from the server's configuration

esbonio.server.includedModules.description: A list of additional modules to include in the server's configuration

esbonio.server.logLevel.description: The level of log message to show in the log

esbonio.server.logFilter.description: A list of logger names to limit output from

esbonio.server.pythonPath.description:
The path to the Python interpreter to use when running the Langague Server.

By default this extension will try to use the interpreter configured via the Python Extension. If you do not use the Python Extension or you wish to use a different environment, then this option can be used to override the default behavior.

esbonio.server.hideSphinxOutput.description: Hide Sphinx build output from the Language Server log.
esbonio.server.hideSphinxOutput.deprecationMessage: This option will be removed when the language server reaches v1.0. The esbonio.sphinx.quiet and esbonio.sphinx.silent options should be used instead.

esbonio.sphinx.buildDir.description:
The directory in which to store Sphinx's build output.

By default the Language Server will store any build files in a storage area provided by coc.nvim, this option allows you to override this to be a directory of your choosing e.g. your local _build/ directory.
esbonio.sphinx.buildDir.markdownDescription:
The directory in which to store Sphinx's build output.

By default the Language Server will store any build files in a storage area provided by coc.nvim, this option allows you to override this to be a directory of your choosing e.g. your local `_build/` directory.

esbonio.sphinx.builderName.description: The builder to use when building the documentation.
esbonio.sphinx.builderName.markdownDescription: The builder to use when building the documentation. **Note:** While many builders will work fine, many features (such as previews) will only work with the `html` builder.

esbonio.sphinx.confDir.description: The Language Server should be able to automatically find the folder containing your project's 'conf.py' file. However this setting can be used to force the Language Server to use a particular directory if required.

esbonio.sphinx.doctreeDir.description: The directory in which to store Sphinx's doctree cache.

esbonio.sphinx.forceFullBuild.description: Force a full build of the documentation project on server startup.

esbonio.sphinx.keepGoing.description: Continue building when errors generated from warnings are encountered

esbonio.sphinx.makeMode.description: Flag indicating if the language server should be have like a sphinx-build -M ... command

esbonio.sphinx.numJobs.markdownDescription:
The number of parallel jobs to use during a Sphinx build.

- A value of `0` is equivalent to passing `-j auto` to a `sphinx-build` command.
- A value of `1` will disable parallel processing.

esbonio.sphinx.srcDir.description: The directory containing your rst source files. By default the Language Server will assume this is the same as `esbonio.sphinx.confDir` but this opton can override this if necessary.
esbonio.sphinx.srcDir.markdownDescription: The directory containing your rst source files. By default the Language Server will assume this is the same as `#esbonio.sphinx.confDir#` but this opton can override this if necessary.

esbonio.sphinx.tags.description: Tags to enable during a build.

esbonio.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between coc.nvim and the esbonio language server.
